item.title: Honda Activa e: and QC1 electric scooter bookings officially open - BikeWale
item.description:
Honda Opens Bookings for Activa e: and QC1 Electric Scooters in India

Date & Source: Publication Date Unknown

Honda has officially opened bookings for its new electric scooters, the Activa e: and QC1, in select Indian cities, requiring a booking fee of Rs 1,000.

  • Bookings are now available in Bengaluru, Mumbai, Delhi, and other cities.
  • The Activa e: is Honda’s first electric vehicle for India, featuring modern technology and performance specs.
  • The scooter comes with swappable batteries, boasting a range of 102 km on a single charge.
  • The QC1 is a budget-friendly option with lower performance specifications.
“Honda claims that the Activa e: can go from 0-60 km/h in just 7.3 seconds.”

Honda plans to launch a network of battery swapping stations across India, with deliveries of the scooters expected to start in February.

item.title: Hyundai Creta EV First Teaser Out Ahead Of January Launch - NDTV
item.description:
Hyundai Creta EV First Teaser Released Ahead of Launch

Publication Date: January Launch, Source: Hyundai India

Hyundai India is gearing up for the launch of the Hyundai Creta Electric, showcasing the first teaser which features a wall-mounted EV charger, promising to revolutionize driving in India.

  • Hyundai has launched the first official teaser for the Creta Electric.
  • The vehicle is poised to be the most affordable EV in India.
  • The design aligns with the ICE version but includes distinct electric elements.
  • Expected features include a fully-digital instrument cluster and advanced safety systems.
  • The Creta Electric will reportedly have a 45 kWh battery providing 450 km range.
“A bold new chapter in electric begins soon. Hyundai Creta Electric is set to change the way you drive, forever.”

The Hyundai Creta Electric appears to be a significant step in Hyundai’s electric vehicle journey, expected to combine affordability with modern features.

item.title: JSW MG Motor India sales up 55% in December at 7,516 units - The Times of India
item.description:
JSW MG Motor India Sales Rise 55% in December

Publication Date: January 8, 2022 Source: Economic Times

JSW MG Motor India has reported significant growth in sales for December 2021, achieving a 55% increase compared to the previous year with a total of 7,516 units sold.

  • Sales increased by 55% year-on-year.
  • Total units sold in December reached 7,516.
  • JSW MG Motor is expanding its presence in the Indian market.
  • The company plans to introduce new models to capture more market share.
"This growth reflects our commitment to providing high-quality vehicles that meet customer expectations." - Company spokesperson

The rise in sales indicates a recovering automotive market and strengthens JSW MG Motor's position in India.

item.title: 52 Week High Stocks Today on January 1, 2025: Muthoot Finance, Coromandel International & others hit 52 week high today ; Do you own any? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
52 Week High Stocks Today on January 1, 2025: Muthoot Finance, Coromandel International & Others Hit New Highs

Date: January 1, 2025
Source: Live Mint

Today, several stocks including Muthoot Finance and Coromandel International achieved their fresh 52-week highs, as Nifty 50 and Sensex showed positive movement.

  • Muthoot Finance, Coromandel International, Jubilant Foodworks, Laurus Labs, and Radico Khaitan hit their 52-week highs.
  • Nifty 50 was up by 11.75 (0.05%) points.
  • Sensex was up by 370.59 (0.47%) points.
  • Bank Nifty witnessed a decline of -23.55 (-0.05%) points.
  • Top gainers in the BSE Sensex included Mahindra & Mahindra, Bajaj Finance, and Asian Paints.
  • Top losers in the Bank Nifty included Federal Bank and Au Small Finance Bank.
  • For the complete list of 52-week high stocks, visit the official site.
For the complete list of 52 week high stocks click here.

Overall, the market shows a resilient performance with numerous stocks reaching new heights, pointing towards investor confidence.

item.title: Nishant Pitti steps down as Easy Trip Planners CEO; Rikant Pittie takes the helm | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Nishant Pitti Resigns as CEO of Easy Trip Planners; Rikant Pittie Appointed as New CEO

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Easy Trip Planners recently announced the resignation of Nishant Pitti as CEO, effective January 1, and the appointment of Rikant Pittie, previously CFO, as the new CEO.

  • Nishant Pitti resigned for personal reasons.
  • Rikant Pittie is promoted to CEO from CFO; he is also Nishant's brother.
  • Nishant sold a 1.4% stake in the company for ₹78 crore prior to his resignation.
  • Rikant Pittie holds a significant stake in the company, amounting to 25.88%.
  • Easy Trip Planners is the parent company of EaseMyTrip.
Nishant Pitti offloaded 4,99,52,163 shares at an average price of ₹15.68, realizing a transaction value of ₹78.32 crore.

The transition in leadership at Easy Trip Planners marks a significant shift in the company's management, with the new CEO expected to steer the company into its next phase of growth.

item.title: Nishant Pitti, Co-promoter of EaseMyTrip, resigns as CEO with immediate effect, cites personal reasons - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Nishant Pitti Resigns as CEO of Easy Trip Planners

Date: January 1, 2025 Source: CNBC-TV18

Nishant Pitti, a co-promoter of Easy Trip Planners, has resigned from his position as CEO, citing personal reasons.

  • Pitti had planned to sell his remaining 14% stake in the company but only managed to sell 1.4% on Tuesday.
  • He has been associated with the company since 2008 and was re-appointed for a five-year term in May 2024.
  • Rikant Pittie has been appointed as the new CEO, effective immediately.
  • Retail shareholding in Easy Trip Planners has increased significantly since its IPO in 2021.
“Dear Board Members, I, Nishant Pitti, hereby tender my resignation from the position of CEO due to personal reasons with effect from January 01, 2025.”

The resignation comes amidst ongoing stake sale activities by Pitti, who previously sold shares to retail investors.

item.title: December Auto Sales: Bajaj Auto shares fall after December sales miss estimates - CNBCTV18
item.description:
December Auto Sales: Bajaj Auto shares fall after December sales miss estimates

Publication Date: January 1, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Bajaj Auto's sales data for December has led to a drop in its shares, as the company fell short of market expectations. Total sales reported were 3.23 lakh units, an overall decline of 1% year-on-year, compared to the anticipated 3.55 lakh units.

  • Domestic sales decreased by 15% year-on-year to 1.62 lakh units.
  • Exports increased by 18% year-on-year to 1.60 lakh units.
  • Two-wheeler segment sales fell by 4%, totaling 2.72 lakh units.
  • Three-wheeler segment sales increased by 16%, with 50,952 units sold.
  • Bajaj Auto's electric two-wheeler segment holds a strong market share of 25%.
  • Brokerage Emkay Global upgraded Bajaj Auto's rating from 'Sell' to 'Add', with a price target of ₹9,500.
“The stock has declined over 30% from its recent peak of ₹12,774.”

In conclusion, while Bajaj Auto's export performance is strong, the decline in domestic sales and overall sales underperformance raise concerns about its current market position.

item.title: Upcoming Hyundai cars to look out for in 2025 - The Financial Express
item.description:
Upcoming Hyundai Cars to Look Out for in 2025

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Financial Express

Hyundai had a busy 2024 and will continue with new or updated models in 2025. Key launches include:

  • Hyundai Creta EV: Launching on January 17, 2025, featuring a 45 kWh battery and 136 bhp.
  • Hyundai Ioniq 5 Facelift: Expected in India in late 2025, with a longer body and improved aerodynamics.
  • New-generation Hyundai Venue: Expected in the second half of 2025, featuring design updates and familiar engine options.
“The upcoming Hyundai Creta EV will compete against the likes of MG ZS EV and Tata Curvv EV.”

These upcoming models signify Hyundai's commitment to electrification and enhancing its presence in the Indian automotive market.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 2 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 17 times so far; Check GMP, review, other key details | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 2 Live Updates

Publication Date: January 1, 2025

Source: LiveMint

The initial public offering (IPO) of Indo Farm Equipment Ltd has received an overwhelming response from investors on its first day, being oversubscribed more than 17 times as it enters the second day of bidding. The issue is set to close on January 2, with a price band of ₹204 to ₹215 per share.

  • IPO subscribed 17.71 times on Day 1.
  • Retail investors portion subscribed 18.55 times.
  • NII portion booked at 28.57 times.
  • QIBs subscribed 8.10 times.
  • Estimated to raise ₹260.15 crore from the book-built issue.
“The issue is priced at a P/E ratio of 51.8x on the upper price band, which is relatively high compared to its peers. However, we recommend a ‘SUBSCRIBE’ rating for the issue.” - Palak Devadiga, Research Analyst, StoxBox

This IPO reflects strong investor interest and potential for future growth in the sector.

item.title: Multibagger stock IREDA share price jumps 6% post business updates; loan book sees 36% growth | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
IREDA Share Price Surges 6% Following Strong Business Updates

Date: January 1, 2024   Source: Live Mint

The Indian Renewable Energy Development Agency (IREDA) saw its share price jump nearly 6% following the release of provisional business updates indicating strong loan book growth.

Business Updates

  • Loan book growth of 36% till December 2024 compared to the previous year.
  • Loans sanctioned worth ₹31,087 crore, representing a 129% increase over ₹13,558 crore in the same period of 2023.
  • Loan disbursements at ₹17,236 crore, a 41% rise compared to ₹12,220 crore the previous year.
  • The outstanding loan book reached ₹69,000 crore, up from ₹50,580 crore in December 2023.

Stock Price Impact

IREDA's share price rose 5.83% to ₹227.70, reflecting positive market response despite having corrected from all-time highs.

Notable Quotes

“Though IREDA share price has corrected significantly from its all-time highs, it still rose 105% in 2024, delivering multibagger returns to its investors.”

The article highlights IREDA's role as a significant financial body in renewable energy and energy efficiency, established in 1987.

Conclusion

IREDA's robust performance and share price increase exemplify its growth in a challenging market, providing valuable returns to investors.

item.title: ITC Hotels Listing: Will the demerged entity become a part of MSCI, FTSE indices? - CNBCTV18
item.description:
ITC Hotels Listing: Will the Demerged Entity Join MSCI and FTSE Indices?

Publication Date: Not specified Source: CNBC TV18

ITC Hotels Ltd., the new hotels business formed by the demerger from ITC Ltd., is preparing for its stock market debut, with analysts predicting its potential inclusion in various market indices.

  • The MSCI plans to temporarily add ITC Hotels as a detached security to their Global Standard Indexes as of January 6.
  • ITC Hotels may qualify for the MSCI Global Smallcap Indexes based on current estimates.
  • The FTSE has yet to announce its stance on the incorporation of ITC Hotels into its indices.
  • ITC Hotels is expected to have a market entry price between ₹150 - ₹175 per share.
Nuvama Alternative expects the share price adjustment post-demerger to be between ₹22 - ₹25 per share.

This listing and potential index inclusion could have significant implications for the valuation and market strategy of ITC Hotels.

item.description:
Stocks to Watch, January 1: Auto Stocks, ITC, Thomas Cook, KPIL, Sun Pharma, SJVN, and More

Date: January 1, 2025

Source: Financial News

NIFTY50 and SENSEX are expected to open flat. The GIFT NIFTY is trading marginally higher.

  • ITC: The hotel business has been demerged into ITC Hotels Ltd as of January 1.
  • KPIL: Awarded new orders worth ₹1,011 crore for T&D, railway, and B&F sectors.
  • Thomas Cook: Undergoing investigation due to a cyber attack on its IT infrastructure.
  • Auto Stocks: Companies like Mahindra & Mahindra and Tata Motors will release December sales data today.
  • Sun Pharmaceutical: Selling its subsidiary in Japan to Zaza Industrial Holdings.
  • SJVN: Signed an MoU with Bihar Government for a 1,000 mW project.
  • Piramal Enterprises: Invested ₹1,000 crore in its subsidiary Piramal Capital.

item.description:
Elon Musk Changes His Twitter Profile Name

Publication Date: October 2023, Source: Times of India

Elon Musk has recently changed his profile name on Twitter, a surprising move that has caught the attention of social media users and fans alike.

  • Many speculate that the change may be a strategic decision related to his various business ventures.
  • Musk's engagement on social media has often influenced market trends.
  • This latest move has sparked mixed reactions online.
“Musk's latest name change is just another topic for discussion among his followers.”

This recent action from Musk continues to illustrate his unpredictable nature in the tech and business world.

Date: October 2023 Source: Economic Times

With analysts forecasting a challenging year for equities in 2025, it is vital for investors to pick the right stocks. This article lists 18 stocks recommended by six leading brokers across various market segments expected to outperform.

  • Bharti Airtel (Current Price: Rs 1,593, Target: Rs 1,880)
  • Fortis Healthcare (Current Price: Rs 720, Target: Rs 860)
  • City Union Bank (Current Price: Rs 172, Target: Rs 215)
  • Hindustan Unilever (Current Price: Rs 2,327, Target: Rs 3,200)
  • Mahanagar Gas (Current Price: Rs 1,282, Target: Rs 1,600)
  • Sobha (Current Price: Rs 1,573, Target: Rs 2,639)
  • Infosys (Current Price: Rs 1,885, Target: Rs 2,250)
  • Jindal Steel & Power (Current Price: Rs 930, Target: Rs 1,150)
  • Aegis Logistics (Current Price: Rs 822, Target: Rs 950)
  • Bajaj Finance (Current Price: Rs 6,835, Target: Rs 8,200)
  • Star Health (Current Price: Rs 474, Target: Rs 700)
  • CEAT (Current Price: Rs 3,235, Target: Rs 4,000)
  • HCL Technologies (Current Price: Rs 1,924, Target: Rs 2,300)
  • Indian Hotels (Current Price: Rs 874, Target: Rs 950)
  • Angel One (Current Price: Rs 2,934, Target: Rs 4,200)
  • ICICI Bank (Current Price: Rs 1,283, Target: Rs 1,490)
  • Anup Engineering (Current Price: Rs 3,470, Target: Rs 3,800)
  • Awfis Space Solutions (Current Price: Rs 724, Target: Rs 1,013)
"Star plans to take a price hike in 65-70% of its retail portfolio in FY25 due to rising claims ratios and high medical inflation."

This compilation aims to guide investors in making informed decisions in the face of predicted challenges within the equities market.

Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today — January 1, 2025

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market shows cautious behavior influenced by weak global cues, as highlighted by Sumeet Bagadia of Choice Broking.

Investors are advised to approach trading with a focus on specific stocks, emphasizing breakout opportunities.

item.title: 9 Most Influential Crypto Cities in the World in 2024 - Decrypt
item.description:
9 Most Influential Crypto Cities in the World in 2024

Publication Date: 2024

Source: Decrypt

Cryptocurrencies have established a stronger foothold in global financial ecosystems, and cities worldwide are vying to be hubs for blockchain innovation and adoption. This year, the industry has progressed, from regulatory clarity to a thriving startup culture. Here are nine cities shaping the crypto landscape in 2024.

  • Berlin, Germany: Germany clarified tax rules for crypto, enhancing its status as Europe’s premier crypto hub.
  • Singapore: Expanded regulatory sandbox provides opportunities for fintech startups in tokenized assets and DeFi.
  • Dubai, UAE: Issued comprehensive crypto guidelines, attracting global exchanges.
  • Tokyo, Japan: Implemented tax reforms to incentivize institutional investment in crypto.
  • Sydney, Australia: Hosted Aus Crypto Con, showcasing local innovations despite slow regulatory development.
  • San Francisco, US: Silicon Valley continues to foster disruptive crypto projects with renewed venture funding.
  • Miami, US: Remains dynamic with events enhancing its crypto hub status.
  • New York City, US: Strengthened blockchain hub with tighter regulations, attracting firms like Circle.
  • Hong Kong: Proposed tax exemptions for crypto gains to enhance its wealth management appeal.
“Berlin is solidifying its place as Europe’s premier crypto hub for 2025,” said Hannes Graah of Zeal.

item.title: These Crypto Industry Stars Shone Brightest in 2024 - Decrypt
item.description:
These Crypto Industry Stars Shone Brightest in 2024

Publication Date: 2024 Source: Decrypt

The digital assets industry smashed records and reached new milestones in 2024, with Bitcoin exceeding $100,000 and many emerging stars in the crypto space making headlines.

  • Sasha Plotvinov’s Notcoin attracted 35 million users, boosting crypto gaming.
  • Dylan Abruscato's Crypto: The Game gained popularity, reaching a prize pool of $115,000.
  • Crypto Twitter influencer Ansem rose to fame with 600,000 followers.
  • Jack Lu led a revival of NFT trading at Magic Eden.
  • Iggy Azalea successfully launched her meme coin, $MOTHER, creating a Web3 community.
“The token's relative success is supposedly a product of Azalea’s dedication to building a Web3 community.”

This year marked significant growth in the cryptocurrency and Web3 sectors as various projects captured public attention and generated discussions among users and investors.

item.title: 'Bengaluru is topping the charts': Swiggy Food CEO reveals who is eating what on New Year's Eve - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Swiggy's Food Marketplace CEO Rohit Kapoor Reveals Eating Trends on New Year's Eve

Publication Date: Dec 31, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

As New Year's Eve celebrations kicked off, Swiggy's CEO provided insights into order trends and the preparations of the company's teams to handle the surge in demand for food delivery.

  • Bengaluru topped the charts for food orders, particularly for biryani.
  • A poll was conducted to predict the most ordered item among pizza, burger, and biryani.
  • Live updates on social media indicated that over 2 lakh orders for pizza and 116,099 orders for burgers were made.
  • A user in Delhi saved ₹41,142 through Swiggy Dineout.
"Guess what? Bengaluru is topping the charts for biryani orders aur woh toh Hyderabadi biryani order kar rahe hain." - Rohit Kapoor

The insights shared by the CEO highlighted not only the operational efficiency of Swiggy but also the preferences of customers in different cities as they usher in the New Year.
